title: Geometry: Area and Perimeter of Complex Shapes

vocab.definition: The amount of space inside a two-dimensional shape
The distance around the outside of a shape
A shape made up of two or more basic geometric shapes
A quadrilateral with opposite sides that are parallel and equal
A polygon with three sides and three angles

teachingNotes: Practice breaking complex shapes into simpler ones. Use grid paper for area calculations. Connect to real-world applications like flooring and fencing.
